bullets.text: Supported a 3,000+ user global workforce across a modern SaaS environment; delivered Tier 2/3 and executive support with consistently high service quality.
Owned asset lifecycle operations across 10,000+ devices (procurement, provisioning/enrollment, refresh, secure retirement), improving availability and reducing waste.
Closed 12,000+ tickets with strong customer outcomes (~99% CSAT, ~95% first-contact resolution) and consistent SLA performance.
Built automation + metrics pipelines (Python/SQL) to reduce manual reporting and surface repeat drivers for proactive remediation.
Led incident execution end-to-end (triage, coordination, comms, follow-through), strengthening ownership and post-incident corrective actions.
Ran weekly change management with 50+ cross-functional stakeholders (IT/Security/Engineering) to reduce regressions and rollout risk.
Recognized with a CISO Award of Excellence (Oct 2022) for cybersecurity-focused operational improvements.
Owned $1M+ budget scope and improved spend efficiency through standardization, vendor leverage, and lifecycle optimization.
Strengthened onboarding/offboarding reliability by reducing human error and improving access-control consistency through better workflows and tooling alignment.
Coordinated with third-party vendors on remediation work, driving measurable reductions in recurring security findings and operational gaps.
Applied AI-assisted support workflows (structured triage templates, symptom capture, KB linking) to improve speed and case quality while keeping outputs grounded and verifiable.
Delivered Tier 1/2 support across a mixed macOS + Windows environment for a distributed workforce.
Built an internal self-service IT site that reduced ticket creation by ~15% by improving knowledge access and request routing.
Established an operating rhythm across IT/Security/Engineering (weekly change reviews, incident follow-through, KPI reviews) to improve predictability and reduce repeat issues.
bullets.notes: Suggested manager-track framing. Approve only if accurate.

bullets.text: Defined and tracked operational KPIs (ticket drivers, incident metrics, change success rates) and used them to prioritize reliability work and reduce operational drag.
bullets.notes: Suggested manager-track framing. Approve only if accurate.

bullets.text: Built a vendor accountability loop (SLAs, remediation tracking, quarterly reviews) to reduce recurring issues and tighten security posture.
bullets.notes: Approve only if you ran this program.

bullets.text: Built local LLM-assisted workflows for support operations (structured triage, knowledge enrichment, response drafting) with guardrails to prevent unsupported claims and ensure verifiable outputs.
bullets.notes: Approve only if you have actually built local LLM workflows (Ollama/LM Studio/llama.cpp).

bullets.text: Introduced lightweight evaluation checks (golden prompts, regression snapshots) to keep AI-assisted workflows consistent and reduce drift over time.
bullets.notes: Approve only if you implemented an eval/fixture system.

bullets.text: Prototyped a retrieval-based knowledge workflow to link incidents and past fixes to new tickets, improving resolution consistency without exposing sensitive data externally.
bullets.notes: Approve only if you built/prototyped RAG-like knowledge linking.
